title: Butchering Large Game Animals
brief: Systematically break down large game into manageable pieces for cooking and storage.
steps: Step 1: Remove front legs by slicing muscle tissue connecting them to body - no bones connect front legs to body.
Step 2: Cut hindquarters at hip joint by cutting around the large leg bone and through the ball-and-socket joint.
Step 3: Cut ligaments around hip joint and bend back to separate.
Step 4: Remove tenderloins - large muscles lying on either side of the spine.
Step 5: Separate ribs from backbone by breaking ribs first, then cutting through breaks.
Step 6: Cut remaining meat into manageable cooking portions.
warnings: Use sharp knife and work carefully to avoid injury.
Breaking ribs before cutting reduces knife wear and effort.
Keep meat clean and cool during processing.
